p:
The current leading method to evaluate complex mixtures is metabolomics
23 . This field consists of the global analysis of small molecules characterizing a biological system, while traditional bioguided fractionation does not consider synergistic effects
24 . When associated with chemometrics, metabolomics will guide the identification given activity markers
25, 26 . Maree et al.
27 recently explored the correlation of antimicrobial activity and chemical composition of various essential oils by GC-MS and statistics (Orthogonal Partial Least Square Discriminant Analysis, OPLS-DA). Their work nominated eugenol as the most potent antibacterial compound in the dataset.
